alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 8:57PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clay, western Randolph and Quitman Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 857 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Cuthbert, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Wire Bridge, Bonapartes Retreat, Watson Crossroads, Peterson Hill, Coles, White House, Moores Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Garnersville, Bagby State Park, Coleman, Hatcher, Morris, Bethel and Benevolence. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
